intro: Mesosphaerum × obvallatum, commonly known as the hybrid snowball vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Passifloraceae family, which includes passionflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of white or cream-colored flowers surrounded by brightly colored bracts, creating a striking visual display. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure. However, it is considered invasive in some areas, where it can outcompete native vegetation.
